thread.section_title: Business & Financial News, U.S & International Breaking News | Reuters
thread.title: Facebook CEO plans to testify before U.S. Congress: source

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Facebook CEO plans to testify before U.S. Congress: source

organizations.name: house energy and commerce committee and senate commerce

text:
(Reuters) - Facebook Inc chief executive Mark Zuckerberg will appear before the U.S. Congress to answer questions on data privacy and other issues, but it is not clear to which committee or committees he will testify, a source briefed on the matter said on Tuesday.
Facebook Founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg speaks on stage during the annual Facebook F8 developers conference in San Jose, California, U.S., April 18, 2017. REUTERS/Stephen Lam The Senate Judiciary Committee has invited Zuckerberg to testify at an April 10 hearing along with the CEOs of Alphabet Inc and Twitter Inc.
The House Energy and Commerce Committee and Senate Commerce committees have also asked him to testify but have not set dates.
Members of Congress want answers on how 50 million usersâ€™ data got into the hands of political consultancy Cambridge Analytica.
Reporting by David Shepardson; Editing by James Dalgleish
